timeline.body: The validate method should really be validating the request object -> `CreateConceptSetRequest#getAddedIds`.  If the size check fails we fail fast instead of doing all the processing to convert it to a db object.

timeline.body: Not sure any of this code is necessary. A `CreateConceptSetRequest` has a `ConceptSet` which can have only 1 domain. If we really feel like we need to validate that the concept ids all belong in the same domain, then we should check this in the controller. Also, there is a much easier way to validate this, just query the concept table for domain count.
timeline.bodyText: Not sure any of this code is necessary. A CreateConceptSetRequest has a ConceptSet which can have only 1 domain. If we really feel like we need to validate that the concept ids all belong in the same domain, then we should check this in the controller. Also, there is a much easier way to validate this, just query the concept table for domain count.
timeline.bodyHTML: Not sure any of this code is necessary. A CreateConceptSetRequest has a ConceptSet which can have only 1 domain. If we really feel like we need to validate that the concept ids all belong in the same domain, then we should check this in the controller. Also, there is a much easier way to validate this, just query the concept table for domain count.

timeline.bodyText:
When renaming a concept set it calls this method and conceptSet.getConcepts throws a null pointer exception. Please wrap this in a null/empty check
  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                validateConceptSet(
          
          
            
                    dbConceptSet,
          
          
            
                    conceptSet.getConcepts().stream()
          
          
            
                        .map(concept -> concept.getConceptId())
          
          
            
                        .collect(Collectors.toList()));
          
          
            
               if (!CollectionUtils.isEmpty(conceptSet.getConcepts())) {
          
          
            
                  validateConceptSet(
          
          
            
                      dbConceptSet,
          
          
            
                      conceptSet.getConcepts().stream()
          
          
            
                          .map(concept -> concept.getConceptId())
          
          
            
                          .collect(Collectors.toList()));
          
          
            
                }
timeline.bodyHTML:
When renaming a concept set it calls this method and conceptSet.getConcepts throws a null pointer exception. Please wrap this in a null/empty check

Suggested change
validateConceptSet(
dbConceptSet,
conceptSet.getConcepts().stream()
.map(concept -> concept.getConceptId())
.collect(Collectors.toList()));
if (!CollectionUtils.isEmpty(conceptSet.getConcepts())) {
validateConceptSet(
dbConceptSet,
conceptSet.getConcepts().stream()
.map(concept -> concept.getConceptId())
.collect(Collectors.toList()));
}
timeline.author: freemabd

timeline.body:
Think we should use `CollectionUtils.isEmpty` here. It does a null and empty check. If the code changes and we passed an empty list during the rename we would still throw a BadRequestException in that case and rename would fail
```suggestion
    if (!CollectionUtils.isEmpty(conceptSet.getConcepts())) {
```
timeline.bodyHTML:
Think we should use CollectionUtils.isEmpty here. It does a null and empty check. If the code changes and we passed an empty list during the rename we would still throw a BadRequestException in that case and rename would fail

Suggested change
if (conceptSet.getConcepts() != null) {
if (!CollectionUtils.isEmpty(conceptSet.getConcepts())) {
